Thankfully, The Let Go, a Seattle-based Hip Hop trio comprised of rappers Kublakai and Type and producer Captain Midnite, donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t take such a played out approach in their recently released album Ã¢â‚¬Å“Tomorrow Handles ThatÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (though they do, on occasion dabble in rapping about rain and/or the lack of sunlight, among other tired Seattle-centric themes). Kublakai and Type somehow find a way to incorporate humor (the kind you actually laugh at, not the Ã¢â‚¬Å“oh, thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s clever Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ so prevalent in the genre) with the introspective observations that seem to be a staple of the subgenre.

The catchy chorus of, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Baby donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t leave meÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ but if you have to leave and thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s what you need to breathe then I ainÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t gonna stand in your way,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ exemplifies the optimistic view of life these guys subscribe to. The albumÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s message culminates in the tell-it-like-it-is track Ã¢â‚¬Å“Easy RoadÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and the inspirational Ã¢â‚¬Å“DesolationÃ¢â‚¬Å“, which summarize the philosophy of embracing lifeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s challenges but not allowing oneself to be bogged down by them.
